meanings.definition: To expose again to something, especially something harmful or unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The doctor warned that too much sun reexposes your skin to harmful UV rays.
meanings.sent2: After the storm, the receding water reexposes the debris left behind.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful magician accidentally reexposes the hidden rabbit in his hat.
meanings.sent4: The detective's investigation reexposes the dark secrets of the small town.
meanings.sent5: The documentary reexposes the harsh reality of life in the wilderness.

meanings.definition: To make something known or visible again after it has been hidden or forgotten.
meanings.sent1: The old photo album reexposes memories of childhood vacations.
meanings.sent2: The historical artifact reexposes ancient writing that was previously unreadable.
meanings.sent3: The gossip magazine reexposes a scandalous celebrity affair from years ago.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise reexposes the beauty of the landscape hidden in darkness.
meanings.sent5: The investigation reexposes the truth behind the mysterious disappearance.
